title: Latent distribution test doesn't work with differently sized graphs
body:
## Expected Behavior
LDT should work on graphs with different number of vertices.

## Actual Behavior
Causes a ValueError

## Template Code
```
n_verts = 50 
P = np.array([[0.9, 0.11, 0.13, 0.2],
              [0, 0.7, 0.1, 0.1],
              [0, 0, 0.8, 0.1],
              [0, 0, 0, 0.85]])
P = symmetrize(P)
csize = [n_verts] * 4
A = sbm(csize, P)
n_verts1 = 100
csize1 = [n_verts1] * 4
A1 = sbm(csize1, P)
ldt = LatentDistributionTest()
p = ldt.fit(A, A1)
```

## Full Traceback
```
ValueError                                Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-10-2bf2a4c66566> in <module>
      1 ldt = LatentDistributionTest()
----> 2 p = ldt.fit(A, A1)
      3 
      4 fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 6))
      5 ax.hist(ldt.null_distribution_, 50)

c:\users\karee\miniconda3\envs\kareef2\lib\site-packages\graspy\inference\latent_distribution_test.py in fit(self, A1, A2)
    143             raise NotImplementedError()  # TODO asymmetric case
    144         if A1.shape != A2.shape:
--> 145             raise ValueError("Input graphs do not have matching dimensions")
    146         if self.n_components is None:
    147             # get the last elbow from ZG for each and take the maximum

ValueError: Input graphs do not have matching dimensions

```

## Your Environment
* Python version: 3.7.3
* GraSPy version: 0.0.3
